items.title: Budget 2026: A close look at India’s GDP growth rate before Sitharaman's key announcements in Lok Sabha
items.summary: India’s GDP growth remains a key focus ahead of Budget 2026, the third budget by Finance Minister Sitharaman in her current term. India recorded a strong Q2 GDP growth of 8.2%, driven by robust consumer spending, festive season stockpiling, and accelerated exports ahead of US tariff deadlines. This growth marks a significant rise from 5.6% a year ago and helps India retain its status as the world’s fastest-growing major economy.

items.summary: ChatGPT may have a smarter rival in Google’s Gemini, but OpenAI is betting that what really wins the AI race isn’t smartness but addiction. Usage numbers suggest that Sam Altman’s chatbot will retain its lead despite rave reviews of Google’s offering.

items.title: HCC share price soars over 14% as board approves  ₹1,000 crore rights issue; check record date and other details
items.summary: HCC share price increased by 14.2% after announcing a rights issue record date of December 5, 2025. The company plans to raise  ₹1,000 crore by issuing 79.99 crore equity shares at  ₹12.5 each, providing existing shareholders a chance to maintain their ownership stakes.

items.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum plunge: BTC sheds 33%, ETH 36% in bear run — What's driving the crypto sell-off?

items.summary: The Indian rupee is experiencing significant pressure and hitting record lows, primarily due to weak capital flows, including foreign portfolio outflows and muted foreign direct investment. items.summary: Apple has appointed former Microsoft and Google executive Amar Subramanya as its new AI chief, succeeding John Giannandrea. The leadership shake-up comes as Apple races to catch rivals in artificial intelligence and prepares a revamped Siri for 2026.

items.title: BYD surges 80% to become one of India’s top five EV makers as import limits ease, footprint expands
items.summary: Two factors contributed to BYD’s growth. First, the company is expanding its footprint in the country. Between 2023 and 2025, its total outlets have nearly doubled to 47. Second, import limits have eased on some of its models as they have been homologated.

items.title: Govt's Sanchar Saathi and SIM-binding mandates a privacy concern, may hit business model: Experts
items.summary: New government directives for OTT apps and phone makers are causing concern.  These rules mandate SIM binding for communication apps and preloading a government app on all new phones.  Industry experts warn of business model threats and user privacy issues.  Legal challenges are being considered.  This move aims to combat digital scams and fraudulent calls across India.

items.title: Air India flew an A320 plane eight times without valid Airworthiness licence
items.summary: Air India operated an Airbus A320 eight times with an expired airworthiness license, risking passenger safety. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) is investigating the lapse, which could lead to significant penalties for the airline and its officials. The carrier has suspended those involved and initiated an internal probe.

items.title: Carlyle Sells Debt of Roomba Maker as Bankruptcy Risks Loom
items.summary: Carlyle Group Inc. sold a troubled loan it provided to iRobot Corp. less than three years ago as the maker of Roomba vacuum cleaners is trying to stave off a potential bankruptcy filing.

items.title: Shein, Temu face fresh heat as Senator demands federal probe into IP theft, counterfeit concerns
items.summary: US Republican senator calls for DOJ and Homeland Security to investigate Shein, Temu for counterfeiting

items.title: Fed’s Bowman Says Bank Regulators Working on Stablecoin Rules
items.summary: The Federal Reserve’s top bank cop plans to tell House lawmakers Tuesday that she will work to establish new rules for banks and stablecoins, as regulators seek to ensure healthy competition between Wall Street, fintechs and crypto firms.

items.title: AI Data Center Firm Iren Seeks $2 Billion in Convertible Bonds
items.summary: Iren Ltd., a data center firm focused on artificial intelligence and high-performance computing, is seeking to raise $2 billion across two convertible bond issues.

items.title: Layoffs sparked by Trump tariffs—Canadian steel maker Algoma to slash 1,000 jobs, roughly 40% of its staff
items.summary: The news comes on the back of the Trump administration's decision to impose 50% tariffs on foreign steel, which Algoma said had severely hit its ability to access the market across the border.

items.title: ESR acquires 60 acres in Pune for 1.35 million sq ft industrial park development
items.summary: ESR is investing Rs 650 crore to develop a 1.35 million sq ft industrial and logistics park in Pune's Talegaon, spanning 60 acres. This move accelerates their India growth strategy, aiming to serve key sectors like automotive and e-commerce. The park's strategic location and modern infrastructure underscore Maharashtra's industrial potential and ESR's commitment to advancing western India's economic growth.

items.title: Padmaja Reddy backs away from microfin, goes for gold
items.summary: Microlending veteran Padmaja Reddy is exiting unsecured business by fiscal end to focus on gold loans, transitioning her firm Keertana Finserv to a 94% secured portfolio. Citing a "structural crisis" in microfinance, Reddy aims for Keertana to be a fully secured lender with gold loans comprising 95% of its assets under management by FY25.

items.title: Silver rallies ₹10,000 on supply crunch, US rate cut hopes

This rally follows a significant increase over the past year, with investment demand projected to rise. Experts foresee continued supply deficits and further price appreciation for the white metal.

items.title: Maruti, Tata clash over small-car concessions in new CAFE norms
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors are at odds over new fuel efficiency rules for small cars. Maruti Suzuki advocates for concessions, citing global practices and affordability for common citizens. Tata Motors opposes any special treatment, emphasizing safety and the original intent of the norms. The debate centers on upcoming CAFE 3 regulations set to take effect in April 2027.

items.title: Expand footwear business to boost exports further: President Murmu

She highlighted significant opportunities in the fast-growing sports and non-leather sectors.  The commerce and industry ministry is supporting investments in this area.  India's footwear exports reached over $2.5 billion in FY25.

items.title: Petrol sales slow in November while Diesel, ATF, LPG sales pick up speed

Aviation fuel demand also picked up pace. Liquefied petroleum gas, essential for cooking, continued its steady growth. These changes mark a reversal of the patterns observed throughout the year.

items.title: Parliament Winter Session: Finance Minister Sitharaman moves two bills for new cess on tobacco and other 'sin goods'

The Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, will apply to pan masala and other notified goods. Revenue from tobacco excise will be shared with states.

items.title: HSBC PMI: Manufacturing activity at nine-month low

Festive season demand also contributed to the dip. While international sales remained strong, overall growth momentum weakened. New orders and output experienced a decline, reflecting tough market conditions and increased competition. Business optimism has also fallen.

The numbers reflect the initial full-month trend after GST rate adjustments. Experts believe consumption growth is offsetting some shortfalls. The government will monitor collections closely.

items.title: India's Industrial output at 14-month low in October

This decline follows a boost from the Goods and Services Tax in September. Factors contributing to the dip include fewer working days due to festivals and the impact of US tariffs. Manufacturing output eased, while mining and electricity also experienced a fall.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
